subject: Design
title: The Arts and Crafts Movement: Rebelling Against Machines
description: A fast breakdown of The Arts and Crafts Movement: Rebelling Against Machines for builders.

hook.text: William Morris looked at factory-made furniture and said: this is making life uglier. He started a revolution.

buildup.text: The Arts and Crafts movement demanded handmade objects, honest materials, and joy in making.

discovery.text: Morris designed wallpapers, textiles, and furniture that celebrated the human hand over the machine.

twist.text: Handmade objects were expensive. The movement that wanted beauty for everyone could only afford it for the rich.

climax.text: Arts and Crafts failed commercially but planted the seeds for the Bauhaus and modern design thinking.

punchline.text: The rebellion against machines shaped how machines eventually designed.

quiz.question: What did the Arts and Crafts movement rebel against?
